reviews.positive_text: Decor was lovely. Reception staff very friendly

reviews.positive_text: Great location. Friendly staff, close to train station and restaurants. The room was very clean, modern, and spacious. I had a room with a small balcony. A refrigerator with free water at check in and was even replaced when the room was cleaned, coffee in the room, and a tea kettle.
reviews.negative_text: A little noisy as they seemed to be working on the building but it was not going on at night. The elevator was not working which was not a big deal for me but it could be for others. Breakfast was okay but too expensive for what was offered. I only ate there the first morning of my stay.

reviews.review_title: Great spot restaurant had good food
reviews.positive_text: Location, location, location Ôøº
reviews.negative_text: Bit noisy, lots of sirens Ôøº

reviews.positive_text: The reception staff are wonderful and very helpful, they were happy to take our luggage up and look after it as we waited for our onwards accommodation to become available. They also arranged for a taxi to make this trip.  The room, a junior suite, was well appointed with an excellent view of St. Raphael.
reviews.negative_text:
The hotel restaurant manager has what can politely be described as a delusion of grandeur. Travelling from Paris that day, we ate at the restaurant for our evening meal and received only lukewarm service at best, as guests of the hotel, this was disappointing. I have eaten at the Intercontinental Carlton in Cannes and have been treated better. We watched as he turned prospective diners away from 'reserved' tables and my French is sufficiently good to understand what he said about them. 
What happened next has never happened to me anywhere in France, and I worked in Paris for several years. Without asking, the bill was placed on the table. Needless to say, I made them wait until we were ready to leave by finishing our drinks.
Exploring St. Raphael and returning at 10 pm, the restaurant was never more than half full, and the 'reserved' tables were never occupied. As we entered the hotel through the restaurant, the manager's face was a picture. Yes, we were guests, and yes, I am leaving this review. We have eaten in some great restaurants around Europe, I love France. However, it was clear to me that the visitors and locals of St. Raphael are well aware of this odd restaurant manager and his delusions of grandeur. 
He didn't spoil our stay but it was a poor introduction to the wonderful Cote d'Azur for my wife and children.

reviews.review_title: nice stay in a lovely area
reviews.positive_text: clean good position with professional staff
reviews.negative_text: food
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double Sup√©rieure - Vue sur Mer

reviews.positive_text: the good quality of the room

reviews.review_title: All nice so we will return next year.
reviews.positive_text: Nice hotel. Nice location. Nice room. Super nice view from 4th floor.
reviews.negative_text: I liked the breakfast at the terrasse with view. I didn't like to order the breakfast the day before and would have liked a larger choice of products.

reviews.review_title: Quite a disaster - do not book breakfast there!
reviews.positive_text: The hotel is centrally located and you get a nice sunset view from the top rooms.
reviews.negative_text: The hotel is an absolute nightmare management -wise. This was our second stay and compared to 2024 , this summer it was an absolute disaster. We booked a suite with breakfast and received breakfast only on the fourth day. The staff was lost, confused and not properly trained. The so-called ‚ÄúDirector‚Äù avoided all questions , remarks and in the end complaints. The suite was good but had a badly leaking shower flooding the bathroom and the toilet. The reception desk was always empty- no staff to be found if you needed assistance. The nicest people I met there were the cleaning ladies who did well their job.

reviews.negative_text: Breakfast was not included, and for 700 euros was not good also when we asked for tea bags it was met with  an attitude that this was a problem
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double Sup√©rieure - Vue sur Mer

reviews.review_title: Terrible. The room was way too hot, the noise kept us awake until 1am.
reviews.positive_text: The room was well designed, except the air conditioning was not up to the task - be warned, if you go when it is very hot, you will frazzle. Don't stay there.
reviews.negative_text: The noise from the restaurant/bar - music until at least 12.30am and the air conditioning did not work well. The room was 28c even with it on full blast. The restaurant/bar stays open until 2am every day and you WILL hear it. They said they would give us a partial refund, for keeping us awake, they LIED, as they did not. Don't stay there until they learn to do what is right. I don't think they care about the rooms, they are an afterthought to the money they make from the restaurant/bar.

reviews.review_title: Good location, good facilities, but street noise from traffic is loud. We also ate at the restaurant that same evening.
reviews.positive_text: Central location, boutique hotel with modern facilities.
reviews.negative_text: Unfortunately a Halloween party had been planned outside on the 1st floor terrace with a DJ just u Der our room. At an average 75db (max 99) from 21:00 - 01:00. Called reception at 11:30 and told it would be over at 12:00 hmmmm.

reviews.review_title: A nice hotel with room for improvement regarding service!
reviews.positive_text: The hotel has a very good and central location with a beautiful view to the harbour. The room was modern and well equiped. Big bathroom with separate toilet. Cleaning was excellent.
reviews.negative_text: The general issue with the hotel is the poor service considering the rating of the hotel. One morning we did not even get breakfast (which we paid for). Subsequently the hotel excused, but did not offer anything as compensation. As a rule there were no people in the reception and if any they could hardly understand English.

reviews.review_title: Pleasant during the week - make sure you check you have a balcony before booking
reviews.positive_text: Location, quality of room, view of the port
reviews.negative_text: Noise from the DJ on Friday and Saturday eve until 1am from sushi bar below room. Also didn‚Äôt like misrepresentation of showing a balcony in the photos of the room when there was no balcony

reviews.positive_text: We loved the location of this property as it was close to ferry pick up and the train station.
reviews.negative_text:
Unable to sleep at night due to the noise 
The fire alarms went off TWICE during our stay which was scary and quite the inconvenience due to having to go outside twice! 
There were no blinds in our bathroom so the sun was just beaming in all day and it was so hot in our room.

reviews.review_title: Great location, but noisy hotel with nightclub below every room
reviews.positive_text:
The location of the hotel is fabulous walk all distance to the beach. The staff at the hotel are really friendly during the day.

The problem occurs at night they have a very loud DJ with their Japanese restaurant. All the rooms in the hotel are above the restaurant the music is loud and continues until 1am. There is no mention of this on the website, which makes it impossible to get to sleep before 1 am. Please be aware of this when booking, because if you have a young family, they will not be able to sleep.
reviews.negative_text: The daytime staff are fabulous. The nighttime staff are young there is no one there available to make any decisions. They have to wait for the manager who is not often at the hotel. The noise of the hotel is unbearable. We booked to stay three nights but only stayed two.

reviews.review_title: Wonderful, relaxing hotel - a gem in St Raphael.
reviews.positive_text:
The hotel was clean and beautifully decorated. The room we had was a bit small, but we knew it would be when we booked it, however it was extremely comfortable and well presented. There was plenty of storage space, a coffee machine and a kettle. The bathroom was immaculate.
The staff were so friendly and helpful. We arrived early and were able to leave our luggage with them. When we went back to check in, they had taken our luggage to our room. Nothing seemed too much trouble.
I can‚Äôt comment on the food as we didn‚Äôt have any, but the restaurant, again was beautifully decorated and always busy.
reviews.negative_text: There was nothing we didn‚Äôt like.

reviews.positive_text: Because it was quiet (end June) we got a room upgrade to a lovely sea view, beautiful room.  We had our breakfasts and evening meals at the restaurant (boring I know) and the food was great.  All staff were charming, helpful and very professional.

reviews.positive_text: It was clean, well-appointed, very friendly and helpful staff, plus a good restaurant.
reviews.negative_text: Despite being an attractive hotel with some good points, it failed in the most fundamental respect. It was impossible to sleep due to road noise all night eg scooters whizzing past in the early hours. The alternative was a closed window and a room that was  too hot. There was an air conditioning unit in the room but it was too complicated to make sense of and there were no instructions in the room. So basically it was a choice of being too hot or suffering too much noise for a good night‚Äôs sleep. Also, the curtains were thin and let in too much light.

reviews.positive_text: Very cute boutique hotel - nicely redone with two restaurants, we had dinner in the classic French brasserie. Altogether a rare find at the C√¥te: charming with extremely friendly and highly professional staff in all parts - from reception to restauration. Will definitely return, merci beaucoup!

reviews.positive_text: It was in a great location right in the main street (but quite). 5 min walk from the train station. 5min walk to 2 lovely sandy beaches. The hotel is beautiful with large rooms and beautiful decor. The staff were lovely and the restaurant was excellent! I would definitely stay here again. The best hotel in San Rapha√´l! 10 out of 10

reviews.positive_text: Big and beautiful rooms. Nice view of the port. Right next to sandy beaches.

reviews.negative_text:
I am writing to express my deep disappointment and frustration regarding my recent stay at your hotel. Regrettably, I found absolutely nothing about the property that met my expectations, and I am compelled to bring my concerns to your attention.

First and foremost, the treatment we received during our stay was far from satisfactory. It was disheartening to experience a lack of professionalism and courtesy from the staff members. Moreover, it became evident that the hotel lacked essential facilities and failed to implement adequate safety measures. This was concerning and greatly impacted our overall experience.

One of the major issues we encountered was the malfunctioning air conditioning system in our room. Despite repeatedly notifying the clerk about this inconvenience since the first night, no action was taken to rectify the situation. This lack of responsiveness was both disappointing and unacceptable.

To exacerbate matters, the noise levels within the hotel were unbearable. We were constantly disturbed by external noises seeping through the windows, which severely impacted our ability to relax and enjoy our stay. Furthermore, we were left utterly disappointed by the lack of assistance provided with our luggage upon entering the hotel. We were forced to carry one of our bags ourselves, which was an unexpected inconvenience.

Lastly, I am astounded that your hotel has been awarded a five-star rating. Based on my experience, I cannot fathom how such a rating was achieved. The numerous flaws and shortcomings I encountered during my stay make it impossible for me to recommend your establishment to anyone seeking a pleasant and comfortable accommodation experience.

In light of the aforementioned grievances, I kindly request an appropriate compensation for the inconveniences endured during my stay at your hotel. I trust that you will address these issues promptly and take necessary measures to prevent similar occurrences in the future.
reviews.room_name: Chambre Double Sup√©rieure - Vue sur Mer

reviews.positive_text: Excellent location, hotel very chic , asian restaurant very good. Rooms super decorated. Staff very nice and professional. I would definitely go back to this hotel.
The location, the view from the room, and the amenities were exceptional! The staff was so kind and helpful as well.

reviews.review_title: Gro√üe, geschmackvoll eingerichtete Zimmer in bester Lage
reviews.positive_text:
Das Touring ist ein hochwertig und sehr geschmackvoll modern eingerichtetes Boutique Hotel (M√∂bel und Ausstattung von Eichholtz!) in direkter Lage am Hafen. Die Zimmer sind schlichtweg fantastisch.
Das Hotel verf√ºgt √ºber keinen Pool, da die Sandstr√§nde jedoch 5min zu Fu√ü entfernt liegen, ist das kein Problem.
Der Service war absolut freundlich und hilfsbereit. Da es sich um ein kleines Hotel handelt haben viele Mitarbeiter mehrere Aufgaben zu bew√§ltigen. So ist w√§hrend des Fr√ºhst√ºcks die Rezeption zeitweise unbesetzt. In diesem Fall kann man jedoch einfach das Personal im Fr√ºhst√ºcksraum ansprechen und bekommt sofort geholfen.
Wir haben den Aufenthalt genossen.
reviews.negative_text:
Einziges √Ñrgernis sind die d√ºnnen Fenster des Hotels, die den Stra√üenl√§rm nicht wirklich abhalten wenn man ein Zimmer mit Hafenblick hat. Hier ist zu w√ºnschen auf drei oder Vierfachverglasung aufzur√ºsten.
Die Minibar ist nicht best√ºckt, das bietet jedoch den Vorteil dass man zu g√ºnstigeren Preisen in den fu√ül√§ufigen Superm√§rkten das kaufen kann was man wirklich konsumieren m√∂chte.
